summary: This document is an email chain from November 2019 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel scheduling a meeting to discuss the Epstein case. It references a recent interview in California with a potential victim who is unsure about pursuing a criminal case, and mentions an upcoming limited proffer session with another individual.

persons.name: Unknown
persons.context: Sender/recipient in email chain discussing case updates and scheduling a meeting; mentions interviewing a potential victim in California.

events.title: California Interview with Potential Victim
events.description: A meeting/interview was held in California with a potential victim. The meeting did not yield significant new information, and the victim is unsure about pursuing a criminal case. An enticement charge was deemed unlikely based on timing/location facts.

events.title: Scheduled Limited Proffer
events.description: An individual (likely a witness or associate) is scheduled to come in for a limited proffer session to discuss their background.

keyFacts: Prosecutors conducted an interview in California with a potential victim who is uncertain about pursuing criminal charges.
The investigation determined an enticement charge was 'almost certainly' not viable due to timing and location facts.
A limited proffer session with an individual was scheduled for the following week.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) on the Epstein case in late 2019.
